result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas V Collins was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The fine is $2706.00 due 60 days or pay plan.

Muncipal blood costs of $65.00 due 60 days or pay plan.

DNA surcharge of $250.00 due 60 days or pay plan.

DNA sample to be submitted.
Huber privileges subject to jail policies.  Huber allowed for employment or treatment.  Good time allowed. 6/27/16 PER JAIL VIOLATIONS-LOSS OF GOOD TIME FOR 30 DAYS.

records.addlTxt: 11:06 am/11:30am  Defendant Thomas V Collins in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases heard 15CF250 & 16CF108.  In 16CF108 reading waived on information.   Factual basis exists.  Defendant pleads no contest  to count 1 in 15CF250.  Court adjudged guilty and enters JOC. Court dismissed count 2.  Court imposes on count 1: 1 year jail with huber for employment or treatment and good time to begin today at 7:00 pm, $2706.00, $65.00 blood draw costs, DNA sample and $250.00 DNA surcharge, 36 month revocation and IID.  AODA and follow through treatment.  1 day jail credit.  Defendant pleads no contest  to count 1 in 16CF108.  Court accepts plea and adjudged guilty of count 1:  sentence with held and 18 months probation with conds: AODA and treatment, DNA sample, $518.00 costs to include surcharge, absolute sobriety.  Not be on premises where alcohol is sold for consumption.  (bars or taverns).  Cash bond on 16CF108 $500.00 cash bond to be applied.  4 days jail credit.
